page.title: 01 Introduction
page.content: The area includes parts of three counties,{Lincolnshire,Leicestershire and{Nottinghamshire,}the boundaries of which meet at a place called{Three {Shires Bush,}south of{Folly Hill.}The spot is marked by a recently planted tree, which is surviving although several earlier ones have died. {Landscape The area is fairly flat with the occasional hill or ridge of higher land. The land is low lying (25 m.) near the River Witham which flows to the east of Long Bennington. The land rises gently to 50 m. at Folly Hill, and falls to 25 m. at Staunton in the Vale and Kilvington where the River Devon and Winter Beck flow.The three main areas of settlement are{Long {Bennington,}with a population of 1,276 {Staunton in the Vale}with 45 and {Kilvington}with 35.
